alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 12:14PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hampshire and northwestern Hampden Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1213 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Montgomery, or 7 miles north of Westfield, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rain and minor street flooding is expected too. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Chicopee, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, South Hadley, Easthampton, Belchertown, Granby, Southampton, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Williamsburg, Huntington, Russell, Westhampton, Chester, Blandford and Montgomery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
